subject: RE: [junit] Missing Resources
msgSnippet: Sorry. Here you go: - JDK 1.3  on Windows NT - JUnit 3.7 -
messageBody:
Sorry. Here you go:
- JDK 1.3 on Windows NT
- JUnit 3.7
- CLASSPATH=.;D:\Progra~1\JBuilder\jdk1.3\lib;E:\GENI\dev\3rdparty\parser\xerces\v1.4.0\xerces.jar;E:\GENI\dev\3rdparty\JUnit\3.7\junit.jar;E:/GENI/dev/bin;E:\GENI\devTest\classes;E:\GENI\dev\3rdparty\logger\v1.0.4\log4j-core.jar
- I invoke "java junit.textui.TestRunner com.fnc.geni.apps.repository.AllTests" for the text-based TestRunner.
- Yes, I can run test cases fine that don't utilize the Swing portion of the code that gets the Resource from the Resource Bundle. I've been using JUnit for about a week or two with uTest (JBuilder plug-in). Recently I added test cases that a) test the GUI portion of the code b) utilize the log4j logger, and that's when the problems started. I decided to get the JUnit TestRunner to work before tackling the uTest problems (which are similar).

-Scott

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Andrew Inggs [mailto:Andrew.Inggs@...]
> Sent: Thursday, July 12, 2001 8:52 AM
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [junit] Missing Resources
>
>
> Scott,
>
> I think you're going to have to give us a little more to go on
> here :-). What JDK are you using, what runtime? What version
> of JUnit? What does the command line that you invoke when you
> get the error look like? What are the values of environment
> variables (e.g., CLASSPATH)?
>
> Have you tried a minimal test case, does it still give the
> error? Something like
>
> // package, import, etc.
> public class MinimalTest extends TestCase {
> // constructor, suite(), etc.
> public void testAlwaysPass() {
> assertTrue(true);
> }
> }
>
> -- Andrew
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Clemmons, Scott [mailto:scott.clemmons@...]
> Sent: 12 July 2001 14:17
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] Missing Resources
>
>
> As an update, I unchecked the Reload classes every run in the GUI
> TestRunners and now I get the same Missing Resources error
> that I'm getting
> with the non-gui version.
> -Scott
